summary: This document is an email chain from February 13, 2020, showing internal FBI communications and an external inquiry from a journalist. The journalist, Alys Key, asks the FBI whether Jes Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank, has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, following news that UK regulators were examining Staley's relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Subject of a UK financial regulator inquiry regarding how he represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer and the board. The journalist inquires if he has been asked to cooperate with the FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case. The email discusses an inquiry related to Jes Staley's social and professional relationship with him.

persons.name: Alys Key
persons.role: Deputy Business Editor for the i newspaper
persons.context: Journalist who emailed the FBI's National Press Office to inquire whether Jes Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in an internal FBI email forwarding the journalist's inquiry, described as 'news of the day'.

connections.description: The document references a dispute over Staley having 'some form of social relationship with Mr Epstein, as well as a professional one'.
Key is a journalist making a formal inquiry to the FBI's National Press Office regarding the Epstein investigation and Jes Staley.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry to FBI on Jes Staley
events.description: Alys Key, Deputy Business Editor for the i newspaper, emails the FBI to ask if Barclays CEO Jes Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation, following news of a UK regulatory probe into Staley's relationship with Epstein.

events.title: UK Regulator Examines Staley-Epstein Relationship
events.description: News emerges that the UK financial regulator is looking into how Jes Staley represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to the Barclays board and how the board relayed that to the regulator.

locations: New York (implied by FBI NY field office)
keyFacts: In February 2020, UK financial regulators were investigating Barclays CEO Jes Staley regarding how he described his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer.
A journalist from the i newspaper contacted the FBI to ask if Staley had been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation.
The FBI's Public Affairs Specialist in New York declined to comment on the inquiry, stating it was 'not something we'd be able to comment on'.
The document indicates the relationship between Staley and Epstein was both social and professional, which was the subject of regulatory scrutiny.
